word: special educational needs and disabilities co-ordinator

uk: ˌspeʃ.əl ed.jʊˌkeɪ.ʃən.əl ˈniːdz ən ˌdɪs.əˈbɪl.ə.tiz kəʊˌɔː.dɪ.neɪ.tər
us: ˌspeʃ.əl ed.jʊˌkeɪ.ʃən.əl ˈniːdz ən ˌdɪs.əˈbɪl.ə.t̬iz koʊˌɔːr.dən.eɪ.t̬ɚ

body_content.explanation:
another expression for 
special educational needs co-ordinator : a teacher who has responsibility for the children in a school who need special care because of an illness or condition that makes it difficult for them to do some of the things that most other people do:
examples: If you want to progress into the role of special educational needs and disabilities coordinator, you'll need to complete the National Award for Special Educational Needs Coordination.
One of the responsibilities of the Special Educational Needs and Disabilities Co-ordinator is to to ensure the curriculum reflects the diverse school community.
